Investors are those who own stock in the company. Speculators are those who purchased XRP. And they didn’t purchase that XRP from Ripple. Ripple doesn’t sell XRP to the general public.
I have been a holder of XRP since 2013 and very active within the community. Ripple has always been a separate, trademarked company. They are holders of XRP. They are not the creators.
This is more $ XRP specific: https://tiffanyhayden.blog/2018/03/28/xrp-is-a-cryptocurrency/ … And this is an example of a potential use case:https://tiffanyhayden.blog/2018/04/01/xrpandamazon/ …

Like other crypto, $ XRP is just a tool. It doesn’t do anything on its own. Its use cases are only limited by our imagination/ability. Let me know if this helps:https://tiffanyhayden.blog/2018/06/06/what-is-ripple/ …
Regardless, @ Ripple is a trademarked company and $ XRP is an untrademarked digital asset. It’s not up for debate.
